headline: Mango Salsa
description: A refreshing mango salsa that's spicy and colorful thanks to the addition of red bell pepper, green onion, jalapeno, fresh cilantro, and lime juice.

video.description: Watch how to make this sweet, spicy salsa.
video.name: Mango Salsa

name: Mango Salsa
recipeIngredient: 0.25 cup finely chopped red bell pepper
1 fresh jalapeno chile pepper, finely chopped

recipeInstructions.text: Place mango, red bell pepper, green onion, jalapeno, cilantro, lime juice, and lemon juice in a medium bowl.
Mix ingredients well to combine. Cover and let sit at least 30 minutes before serving.

review.reviewBody: I made this today and served it on top of fabulous whitefish right out of Lake Superior. I cut back on the jalapeno (used only about 1/2 of a nice sized one.) I added an extra tablespoon to each of the fresh squeezed juices, 1/4 teaspoon of kosher salt, and a cut up fresh peach. Absolutely fabulous. I'm sure it will be wonderful on chicken and pork. Will be making more of this and sharing jars of it with my friends. I'm sure they'll be asking for the recipe!

It is absolutely wonderful! I will NEVER eat anything else on my hamburger. It is easy to make, 10 minutes at the most. Peeling and slicing the mango is the longest part of this recipe and letting the flavors meld together.

Delicious! Served as side to pan-grilled salmon. Didn’t have jalapeños, so sprinkled in some Penney’s fajita blend seasoning, and used all lime juice with a squirt of agave nectar. Mixed in half a can of drained pineapple tidbits. Big hit with DH.

Good salsa alternative for those who don't eat tomatoes. Reasonably good consistency chunk-wise, but a little bland & liquidy for my taste. Some things I would recommend: 1. use a very ripe mango, which is more like the tomato texture in a salsa, 2. I doubled the jalapeno and used yellow onion instead of green--I like things hot, 3. finish with salt to taste after it sits, 4. longer sitting is better for flavor and texture, 5. cut back on the lime and lemon juice to more like a little over 2 total tablespoons if your other ingredients are adding more that average moisture.
I love this Mango Salsa. I use it to substitute in the Mahi Mahi with Coconut Rice and Mango Salsa also from this site.
This was very good with Pork chops. I did omit the Cilantro because we had a few people with adverse reactions to it. I also, changed to red Onion. Everyone loved it and asked for the recipe!
Perfect blend of spicy,sweet and tangy.

I loved this recipe! I had really small mangos so I ended up using 4 instead of 1. I put the mango in last so I just kept adding it until the proportions looked right. We absolutely loved it! I decided to just use lime instead of lemon and didn’t actually measure.
Good base recipe. I used red onion in place of green. 4 diced sweet multi color peppers in place of bell pepper. Added up to a Tb of finely chopped cilantro.
Mango salsa is so great on fish tacos and this recipe was awesome. We used 2 Tbs of chopped onion and a dash or two of Trader Joe’s chili lime seasoning in place of green onions and jalapeños.
Mango salsa is so great on fish tacos and this recipe was awesome. We used 2 Tbs of chopped onion and a dash or two of Trader Joe’s chili lime seasoning in place of green onions and jalapeños.

My family LOVED this! I did not use the hot pepper (personal preference). I used chopped tomato (we didn’t have grape tomatoes). I didn’t have green onion, so I diced up about 3 tablespoons of yellow onion. Next time I will add extra cilantro. I also added the avocado. I let it sit in the fridge for about 45 min. I served it with grilled chicken breast and yellow rice.
used red onion instead green onion- it was delicious! sweet,spicy, and satisfying! Thank you!
This was absolutely delish! I swapped out the cilantro with mint and used a little bit of scotch bonnet instead of jalapeño. We just about licked the bowl.
Was super easy recipe to make. It is wonderful over a white fish. Will definitely make this Ibe, again.
Omg! Yum!!!!
Made it for a competition got many complements
Liked it but mango wasn't sweet enough. Added pineapple chunks and honey to adjust taste.
So fresh and delicious! I added red onion instead of green onion, cherry tomatoes and avocado. I will definitely make this again!
Delicious

I made this and didn't change a thing. It was spectacular. I made it to top some blackened grilled grouper, but we ate the leftover salsa with chips later on. So good. A new staple in the house. I plan to add a bit of pineapple next time around, should be good!
i made this the other night and it sat in my fridge for a day until i was had the time to enjoy. very good recipe i ended up using an old salsa jar to store the rest for later.
Soooooo yummy !!!! I put it on top of some hot breaded baked chicken breasts! Each bite was delicious!
I did not include the jalapeño pepper just as a preference. This salsa is absolutely delicious! I served it as a side dish to crab cakes and it was a perfect complement.
Big hit with the family. Served with Key West Chicken. Perfect combi.
THis salsa was so quick and easy to make! We used it ov er our grilled Salmon and our guests loved it! We also served it with tortilla chips and it was a hit!
Quick and easy to make. We loved the light fresh taste.
I love it with chicken.
This was SO SO good! My guest were talking about it the next day. I had it with the tostitos chips with a hint of lime and it was exceptional!! I will definitely make this again and again!
Perfect for a topping over grilled chicken!
Didn't have the pepper, but made it anyway. Love it! So easy and delicious. I used jarred Mango that was already sliced in extra light juice.

If I could give this recipe 10 stars, I would. I absolutely love it and made it again today. The only change made was to use a couple tablespoons red onion instead of green onion (what I had on hand). The quantities are flexible - add more or less of what you like. Today, I put a few tablespoons on a piece of salmon, wrapped it in parchment paper, and baked it in the oven. When it was done, I added more of the raw salsa on top. I can't say enough good things about this recipe - it tastes great on salmon, other fish or chicken breast or with tortilla chips as a snack. It's quick and easy to make. It keeps extremely well in the fridge for a few days. It's addictive and healthy. Use fresh lime and lemon, if you can. Love - Love - Love - Love - Love this recipe.

Thanks for posting this recipe. I kept seeing recipes for Mango Avocado Salsa, so I added an Avocado to this as I had some on hand. Reminder - you really need to let this sit in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes before tasting. I kept thinking it was missing something and the remembered it needed time for the flavors to marry. After sitting in the refrigerator overnight, it was AWESOME!!! Will definitely make again.
I forgot to add to my previous review that I used the left over salsa as a “dressing” for shredded cabbage salad. It was excellent!
This was a really nice recipe. I made it just as written. I served it with fish and it was a great compliment. I marinated for a few hours. Delicious. Thank you.
I wanted to try a new Salsa. This was perfect with Tortilla Chips and very quick and easy. Tadtes great. Will definitely be making again.

Suuuper good! We had it on breakfast burritos and as a dip later on. I added a Serrano instead of jalapeno, I added two tomatoes from the garden, I added a pinch of salt and pepper (The flavors come out so much better) I didn't measure it, just went by eye.... I did half a lemon and half a lime. I processed it because cutting herbs and the Serrano are such fiddly little jobs. SOOOO GOOD!
tasted so good,saved it to make again...yummy...
Really tasty with a nice zing. I used frozen mango as its difficult to get fresh mango where we live and it’s more economical. Also added a little pineapple
Yumimy !!! Also added 1/2 of a small red onion and 1/2 ripe peach. I love the crunch of the onion and red pepper (used 1/2 cup red bell pepper).
Substituted a diced red onion that I had on hand instead of green onions. Turned out fantastic with baked fish.
Changed a little, was a huge hit. Everyone loved!
I make a double or triple batch. Bring some to a bbq with chips for an appetizer and save the rest for later. A perfect accompaniment to grilled fish, chicken, pork... yum!!
It really needs salt. The salt brings out the flavors...it’s really kind of bland without it.

I served this salsa as a side to grilled swordfish and alongside Basmati rice and steamed broccoli florets. I followed the recipe for the most part except I don't measure - generally go by sight and personal preference. I left the mango in larger chunks but minced the red bell pepper and a bit of red onion along with the green onion and jalapeno. I added a small handful of chopped flat-leaf parsley and cilantro mixed from my herb garden. It marinated in the juice of 1 medium lime and about 1/3 of a large lemon. The presentation on the plate was quite appealing with the brightness of the salsa next to the swordfish and the brightness of the steamed broccoli and the rice. Will absolutely use this salsa many times in many different ways.
BTW: some of add-ins suggested by previous reviewers sound quite yummy - black beans, tomatoes, peaches/nectarines, splash of balsamic - endless options!
Delish! Easy to make and better than what I've had at some fine restaurants. Super dish will elevate your meal 110%

I used only half of a green jalapeno pepper, the taste was mild and next time I would use a whole jalapeno.

I made it just once. I wasn't able to change the number after needing to edit entry.
Love this salsa. Quick and easy and delicious on blacken fish!
Love this recipe, it's quick, easy and ALWAYS a hit!
This is my go to mango recipe! I follow as written and it never fails. Make sure your mango is completely ripe. Serve over chicken or pork...delicious.
Easy to make and so delicious!
Added a little zip to the Mahi -Mahi Dish ....

The proportion of jalapeno to mango was way to high for my family, but even halving the amount of jalapeno just didn't give it the the fruit/kick combo my kids and and husband like. On the their advice, I added a 1/2 Cup pineapple and a little ginger for more of a sweet spice kick. It was excellent on fish, but it wasn't the original recipe.
Pureed the mango for smoother dipping. This was great on shrimp tacos and also on chips!
I think mine didn't work out because the fruit was lacking, however I didn't care for the recipe itself, I have made better fruit salsas
You

I did change the recipe a bit, but they only reason I'm knocking off 1 star is because like another mentioned, it needs a bit of salt to help bring the flavors out. 
Because I was using this in fish tacos, I did make a couple of adjustments. Replaced green onion with red onions and added tomato, and added salt. 
Turned out great! I'm eating the leftover salsa with fresh baked tortilla chips now!
Recipe was simple and delicious! My first time using fresh mangoes. I'll make this again.

Really good, quick and simple! Served this over grilled chicken and it was perfect, thanks :)
Update: Made again and served it on beef fajita lettuce wraps, yummy again!!

Thanks for sharing :) I forgot to buy the cilantro but we still loved it ..i used regular onions, fresh lemons but I used concentrated lime justice and added tomatoes... I'll try it your way next time.

I've never tried a salsa like this before and I was pleased to have finally tried such a great mix of flavors! My wife and I found a spicy mango brats one night and cooked it up with some peppers. We realized that the hint of sweetness of the brat and the peppers was just not enough. So we found this recipe for the next time we do brats. Unfortunately we never found the spicy mango when we last went shopping, but we improvised with a spicy chorizo. The flavors were perfect together! Super simple, tasty and inexpensive to make! I should mention, we got some perfect mango and my butter fingers dropped one of the perfects cuts I had onto the floor. A little disappointed, but still, great mix of flavors!

Made this salsa to go with swordfish and used what was left to go with chicken the next day . Delicious... A very bright and flavorful way to liven up a meal. The only substitution was a red chili pepper instead of a jalapeno
just perfect. could be spicier but that was easily accomplished.

One of our favorites. Very refreshing and colorful. Didn't change a thing. Perfect with fish or tortilla chips. We prefer finely chopped rather than chunky. Used a Pampered Chef food chopper to make quick work of it.

This is a good simple classic mango salsa just the way it is. And easy to adjust to own taste. I added a little salt and replaced lemon juice with orange juice. But it really would have been OK to leave out the salt, since there is plenty of salt on the chips, and orange juice just happens to be more liked by the many kids I tend to feed. Left out the green onions because I didn't have them and they weren't really needed in this recipe, for color (cilantro does the job) or flavor (plenty of sweet and sour onion flavors already). If you don't want a chunky salsa, just put it in the food processor (will become like pico de gallo) or dice it smaller. If you don't like it raw, roast some of your vegetables first. If you like a softer onion flavor, switch with red onions. Many reactions to this recipe made me scratch my head a bit.

Sorry to say this recipe was so disappointing. I love using fresh fruit and vegetables but this really was nothing but chopping and it's more like a bland chutney. For a mango salsa recipe it really should have called for more mango. I tried to alter it but gave up trying.
Fabulous
Absolutely the best on salmon or chicken. This will be on my table again.

Amazing! Everyone loved it! I literally heard someone say that this salsa tasted like happiness :-) My daughter was so upset when she went back for more and saw it was all gone. One thing I suggest was that I made it the day before so it could set and then the next day I drained most of the juice off after giving it a really good stir. Definitely going to make this again!!!

This salsa is PHENOMENAL. My brother made it for Christmas this year and since then I've made it twice, once in a double batch for New Year's (it was a huge hit!!). I love this salsa so much, and it's even a healthy snack, so that's a bonus. I will be making this many, many more times in the future.
Definitely

We put this on the Lori's famous crab cakes (on this site). Yum! Leftovers are good with chips or just eating plain. A very bright healthy and summery taste. Good as a seafood sauce if you are not in the mood for creamy/heavy sauces.
I found it inedibly acidic when I made it as is. I had to add a tablespoon of sugar, and saute it in 1/4 cup of orange juice in order to be able to eat it.
Great! I left out the bell pepper and used red onion instead of green.
Loved it! Have served it two ways: over grilled chicken breasts and with tortilla chips.
Loved it! Can't wait to make it again!
Very good and simple recipe. Perfect amount of heat. Used this as a topping for grilled blacked tuna steaks and it complimented the fish and spices perfectly!
Easy and delicious!!!
This is great on any fish. We do not like it too hot so we eliminated the hot pepper and substituted organic red and yellow sweet peppers.
So quick and easy and tastes amazing. I'm sure you could change anything you wanted to and it would still be great, but this was a perfect mix of sweet, salty, hot, and fresh tasting.

This was really good. I made it exactly like this but I did throw in a few cherry tomatoes I had that needed to be used up. This will be my go to summer salsa I make. I added this on top kf steam baked chicken with rice on the side. It was delicious.
Love it. Served with tilapia and also salmon. Favorite is tllapia.
This is delicious! I made it exactly as the recipe and I don't think I need to change anything! Thank you so much for sharing it.
I omitted the jalapeño simply because I don,t like them. It was lovely, sweet and light
So I did something a little different. I cooked some of the mango in butter along with the peppers. it was great mixed into the uncooked mangos.
Delicious and refreshing, especially after sitting a couple of hours in refrigerator. I used Champagne mangoes, my favorite. I just ate it by itself I liked it so much. Thanks for recipe!

Great recipe. Sweet heat, I'm serving with grilled chops and white rice. My jalapeno was really hot and I wish I had only put in half of it. Next time I'll taste test the pepper, lol. I may add some tomato to bring the heat down.
This was a BIG hit in my house! It is a perfect summer treat. I put it on top of our chicken tacos. But it goes perfect with some chips as well!

Made a double batch exactly as written. Made it about 9 hours ahead of time and glad I did, as it was much better after allowing the flavors to blend. Mild, but would be delicious with more heat as well. Delicious as is.
Great recipe, one that is used in our area of Southern California to top fish tacos. More jalapeño is used along with fresh minced garlic to taste.
This recipe is as good as it is versatile. I use red peppers rather than green for color and taste. But I always make larger batches simply because I love the stuff. Whenever mangoes go on sale.

This is an outstanding basic mango salsa that I will be making throughout this mango season. The first batch was gone in 24 hours! And that in a family that is not that crazy about the spicy dishes I create.
It was delicious! I omitted the red peppers because I'm not a fan of bell peppers but it was good without it. Put this with some guac on a burger and it's heaven!

I made this to eat with lightly blackened flounder. One reviewer said this wasn't a sweet salsa and they were right. It also wasn't a savory salsa...it was a "twangy" salsa. I wish I tasted it before adding so much lime and lemon juice. Even though really ripe lemons and limes are a little sweeter, they are still tart. To remedy the tartness, I added some salt, which helped a little and then added some Splenda which I keep on hand just for times like this. It doesn't take much and dissolves quickly in a dish that's already prepared. I ended up making it sweeter because, because at that point, I thought it tasted better (and less tart) the sweeter it got. Next time I'll try using a lot less lime/lemon juice or maybe just go with orange or pineapple juice instead. I also used red onion because I didn't have any green onions and I used only a few sprigs of fresh cilantro instead of the amount called for. I've found it can be overpowering in large amounts and I don't like it as much as I once thought I did. I would make it again because I still ended up liking it, but I'll try just using less lime and lemon juice first next time.
This is an excellent mango salsa, and it's fast and easy to make. I've made it several times and it never fails. It's become my go-to salsa for fish tacos.
First time ever eating mango salsa and love it. Easy to make!!!

I rated it 4 Stars because I hate cilantro. I used Broad leaf Italian parsley fresh from my garden. Also used chives instead of onions. No lemon juice because I thought that the mango was sour enough. I did use lime juice however. I also used fresh avocado. This is my first go at mango. We'll see how much I like it.

Quick and easy. I used it with a grilled pork roast rubbed with Cajun seasoning. Great contrast. Company loved it. I have also used it with a Grilled Cajun Mahi Mahi which was equally good. I have found that other fruit works well with the mango-try peaches.
I added a can of Ro-tel tomatoes with cilantro and lime and used regular white onion, a whole lime zest and juice and it was delicious!
